meta_description: It's increasingly common worldwide for celebrities and high-profile sports stars to come out, often to widespread public support. But in China, women's soccer star Li Ying received a very different reaction.
meta_title: China's LGBTQ community is fading from rainbow to gray - CNN
title: China's LGBTQ community is fading from rainbow to gray - CNN

body:
>China decriminalized homosexuality in 1997 and removed it from its official list of mental disorders in 2001.
But with same-sex marriage still illegal and Chinese authorities banning "abnormal sexual behaviors" from the media in 2016, the impression among many is that LGBTQ people are free to explore their identities — so long as they do so in private.
body_html: China decriminalized homosexuality in 1997 and removed it from its official list of mental disorders in 2001. But with same-sex marriage still illegal and Chinese authorities banning "abnormal sexual behaviors" from the media in 2016, the impression among many is that LGBTQ people are free to explore their identities — so long as they do so in private.

body:
The thing is even though this is China I bet the CCP took one fucking look at the west and just immediately went "Not in this country" the 'LGBT' groups are trying to represent themselves as innocent support groups but if you look at the language it's the exact same bullshit buzzwords but they've catered it to the Chinese.

> "Nationalist trolls stigmatize LGBT activists as being supported by foreign forces. Just like what they did to the feminist activists," the LGBTQ artist said.

Found this quote particularly interesting, note how they don't use 'far right' or 'right wing' but 'nationalists' who as it so happens if you know China's history are the losers of the civil war and the remants of the Chinese nationalist movement are in Taiwan. The SJW mindset is all about finding an outside enemy to latch onto and be afraid of, far right or right wing wouldn't really work in China because of the way the politics are so they're having to claim it's nationalists sending that shit. It will be fascinating to see if the SJW ideology starts infesting China and backfires.
body_html:
The thing is even though this is China I bet the CCP took one fucking look at the west and just immediately went "Not in this country" the 'LGBT' groups are trying to represent themselves as innocent support groups but if you look at the language it's the exact same bullshit buzzwords but they've catered it to the Chinese.

"Nationalist trolls stigmatize LGBT activists as being supported by foreign forces. Just like what they did to the feminist activists," the LGBTQ artist said.

Found this quote particularly interesting, note how they don't use 'far right' or 'right wing' but 'nationalists' who as it so happens if you know China's history are the losers of the civil war and the remants of the Chinese nationalist movement are in Taiwan. The SJW mindset is all about finding an outside enemy to latch onto and be afraid of, far right or right wing wouldn't really work in China because of the way the politics are so they're having to claim it's nationalists sending that shit. It will be fascinating to see if the SJW ideology starts infesting China and backfires.

body: I'm not sure I buy this. China is communist and typically SJW/progressive, and this report does not match previous ones. My suspicion is that our SJW media wants to "prove" they're not associated with China.

body: North Korea isn't communist? I don't buy that for a second. They're obsessed with socialism, government control and wealth distribution, and hating capitalists. Their worst enemy is the US and their propaganda against us is eerily similar to America-hating SJWs.
body_html: North Korea isn't communist? I don't buy that for a second. They're obsessed with socialism, government control and wealth distribution, and hating capitalists. Their worst enemy is the US and their propaganda against us is eerily similar to America-hating SJWs.

body:
Those things aren’t necessarily bad things or communist things. Hating capitalists is based. Socialism isn’t also always a bad thing, depending on your scale and definition (for example, I’m socialist for my own family and people; people in close knit groups shouldn’t be trying to one-up each other for self-gain, that’s just sociopathy; but I’m libertarian for people I don’t know and are not related to me and don’t share any heritage with me). The internationalism aspect of communism is the thing that gets my goat. And NK doesn’t seem to have that, it’s like self-contained, and they’re pretty proud of being Korean afaict. The leader seems to use the ghost of communism to just keep control. There isn’t any wealth to be distributed in the first place.

Propaganda against the US… you’ve seen the shit we do. Spread degeneracy. Do Israel’s bidding. Invade random countries and spread further degeneracy through our puppet governments, and commodify the local culture so our billionaires can find a new market to consume their shitty Chinese goods. No wonder they’re making propaganda. It’s not as effective compared to the propaganda aimed at us to keep us consuming, but at least they try to resist.
body_html:

The internationalism aspect of communism is the thing that gets my goat. And NK doesn’t seem to have that, it’s like self-contained, and they’re pretty proud of being Korean afaict. The leader seems to use the ghost of communism to just keep control. There isn’t any wealth to be distributed in the first place.

Propaganda against the US… you’ve seen the shit we do. Spread degeneracy. Do Israel’s bidding.
